context_of_use: This use case allows customers to add products to their cart, checkout, and track the status of their orders within the e-commerce system.
stakeholders_and_interests: customer: wants to efficiently purchase multiple items and track their orders.
description: This use case enables customers to add products to their cart, proceed to checkout, and track their order status.
preconditions: Customer is logged into the system.
Customer has selected products to purchase.
postconditions: Customer's order is successfully placed and tracked.
Customer can view the order status.
assumptions: The customer has a valid account to log in.
requirements_met: The system shall allow customers to add products to their cart.
The system shall enable customers to checkout using multiple payment methods.
The system shall provide order tracking functionality.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on payment methods available during checkout.
main_flow: 1. Customer adds products to cart → System updates cart with selected products.
2. Customer proceeds to checkout → System displays checkout options.
3. Customer selects payment method → System processes payment.
4. System confirms order placement → System provides order confirmation and tracking information.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 2): Customer decides to browse products → System redirects customer to product browsing interface.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 3): Payment processing fails → System notifies customer of payment failure and prompts for a different payment method.
